project.teaser: EVELIXIA brings together 36 high profile organizations from 12 EU countries envisioning to realize Buildings as Active Utility Nodes (BAUNs), rendering the EU Building stock as: a) energy efficient; b) connected, by facilitating a two-way communication between the grid and the...
project.objective: EVELIXIA brings together 36 high profile organizations from 12 EU countries envisioning to realize Buildings as Active Utility Nodes (BAUNs), rendering the EU Building stock as: a) energy efficient; b) connected, by facilitating a two-way communication between the grid and the occupants, capitalizing on flexible technologies; c) smart, by utilizing analytics supported by sensors and controls to co-optimize efficiency, flexibility, and occupant preferences; and d) flexible, reducing, shifting, or modulating energy use according to occupant needs, while considering utility signals. EVELIXIA structures the advancement of its solutions along five Innovation Pathways: IP1: Building-to-Grid (B2G) Services; IP2: Grid-to-Building (G2B) Services; IP3: Human-to-Building Interfaces & Interactivity; IP 4: Systems Interoperability; and IP5: Innovative HW as Flexibility Enablers, which will be integrated, deployed, and validated at 7 large-scale, real-life pilots (GR, RO, FR, FI, ES, AT, DK). During the EVELIXIA platform deployment and validation, different actors (i.e., DSOs, DNOs, ESCOs, aggregators) from various sectors (electricity, heating/cooling, mobility) will exchange data for providing B2G and G2B services and they will participate in the development of Business Models showcasing the economic viability of the solutions proposed. EVELIXIA puts a large focus on social engagement empowering citizens as not only adopters of solutions, but also, as their co-creators applying methodologies for citizen and consumer engagement and advanced human to building interfaces. Key expected outcomes include: 14 scalable B2G/G2B services demonstrated including DSF (implicit, explicit, shifting, etc.), P2P energy trading, portfolio management (day ahead/intra-day), TSO/DSO/DHO, and system planning services; GHG emissions reduced by 17%, increase of flexibility by up to 25%, increase of self-consumption up to 100%, reduce energy consumption by 13.5%, and increase RE generation by 11%.
project.title: Smart Grid-Efficient Interactive Buildings
project.keywords: smart buildings, active utility nodes, building-to-grid integration solutions, energy storage, RES, building-to-grid interoperability, predictive maintenance, interoperable platform, big data

article.title: Smart-grid ready and smart-network ready buildings as active utility nodes

result.title: Ensuring real-time data integrity in smart building applications: A systematic end-to-end comprehensive pipeline evaluated in numerous real-life cases

details.authors: Aliki Stefanopoulou, Iakovos Michailidis, Georgios Karatzinis, Georgios Lepidas, Yiannis S. Boutalis, Elias B. Kosmatopoulos
Panagiotis Michailidis; Iakovos Michailidis; Socratis Gkelios; Elias Kosmatopoulos

result.title: Pilot Implementation Planning and Preparations
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 5.2 (both subtask 5.2.1 and 5.2.2), consolidating all foreseen developments on pilots’ implementation planning, preparation works, appropriate permissions, necessary equipment purchases/procurements execution, functional maintenance of commercial equipment and the pilot managers’ training on EVELIXIA’s solutions. This report is considered as the first version of D5.4.

result.title: Report on clustering activities and stakeholder engagement
result.description: Brief description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 7.3 and Task 7.4. This report is considered as the first version of D7.9, consolidating EVELIXIA’s stakeholders’ engagement and clustering activities.

result.title: Novel energy generation systems for increasing buildings flexibility poten-tial
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 2.2 and Task 2.3, consolidating all foreseen technical developments from the different renewable power generation and thermal storage systems’ technology providers. This report is considered as the first version of D2.4.

result.title: Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication Plan (PDEC)
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 7.1. This report is considered as the first version of D7.2, consolidating efforts on dissemination, communication and exploitation planning of EVELIXIA’s results/outcomes.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 8.4, comprising EVELIXIA’s data and ethics management plan first version. This report is considered the first preliminary version of D8.7.

result.title: Drivers, barriers, and Stakeholders’ Requirements for BAUNs
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 1.1, considering the identification of the different factors that enable or hinder the transformation of smart buildings into transactive/autonomous utility nodes of the multi-vector network. It comprises the first version of D1.2, that will focus on the identification of all stakeholders’, relevant performance, security, data management, scalability, and replicability requirements at Pilot levels; through dedicated workshops and questionnaires deployment.

result.title: Exploitation Roadmap
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 7.2. This report is considered as the first version of D7.7, consolidating EVELIXIA’s KERs definition, exploitation planning and IPR management activities.

result.title: Project Management Handbook (PMH)
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 8.2, Task 8.3 and Task 8.4, consolidating EVELIXIA’s administrative, technical, scientific, quality, risks, ethics, gender, and security management plans.

result.title: Project Web and Social Media Presence
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 7.1. This deliverable refers to the development of the project’s web presence (website design, website content, website launch and SEO optimization, social media pages and content, project identity, promotion videos).

result.title: Novel energy storage systems for in-creasing buildings flexibility potential
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 2.1, consolidating all foreseen technical developments from the different novel energy storage-related technology providers. This report is considered as the first version of D2.2.

result.title: Data quality maintenance mechanisms
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 3.3, consolidating all foreseen technical developments on EVELIXIA’s platform data curation and transformation mechanisms. This report is considered as the first version of D3.4.

result.title: Integrated EVELIXIA B2G and G2B Services Layer and Orchestration
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 4.6, consolidating all foreseen technical developments on EVELIXIA’s services layer brokerage, workflow management, orchestration and services functional integration. This report is considered as the first version of D4.8.

result.title: Pilot Site Surveys results, Use Cases definition and market needs analysis
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 1.2, considering the definition of the current technical status of the different pilot sites as well as the definition of the relevant use cases in terms of functional and business needs of the engaged pilot site stakeholders. It comprises the first version of D1.4.

result.title: Autonomous Building Digital Twins
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 4.1 and Task 4.2, consolidating all foreseen technical developments on situation awareness, forecasting and autonomous decision-making mechanisms at building level. This report is considered as the first version of D4.2.

result.title: EVELIXIA platform architecture and integration Roadmap
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 1.4, considering the End-to-End ICT architecture design, the operational workflow definition and the functional requirements of EVELIXIA’s solution. It comprises the first version of D1.8.

result.title: EVELIXIA Evaluation Framework with KPI Repository, and Stakeholder Management Plan
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 1.3 (both subtask 1.3.1 and 1.3.2), considering the consolidation of the EVELIXIA evaluation and impact assessment framework as well as the stakeholder engagement strategy to feed the social engagement field (WP7). It comprises the first version of D1.6.

result.title: Platform external communication and common information management
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 3.1 and Task 3.2, consolidating all foreseen technical developments on EVELIXIA’s platform interoperability, appropriate connectors, common information modelling, and knowledge repository. This report is considered as the first version of D3.2.

result.title: Autonomous District Digital Twins
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 4.3 and Task 4.4, consolidating all foreseen technical developments on situation awareness, forecasting and autonomous decision-making mechanisms at district and network levels. This report is considered as the first version of D4.4.

result.title: Data enabling pilot monitoring plat-forms
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 2.4, consolidating all foreseen technical developments on field-level monitoring and data collecting platforms; as well as the appropriate adaptation of their APIs to enable interfacing with EVELIXIA’s solution. This report is considered as the first version of D2.6.

result.title: Dissemination, and Communication Report
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 7.1. Maintaining the web and social media pages and corresponding dissemination and communication material is also foreseen. This report is considered as the first version of D7.4 and D7.5, consolidating EVELIXIA’s dissemination and communication activities execution.

result.title: Integrated EVELIXIA Middleware Layer’s and Orchestration
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 3.6, consolidating all foreseen technical developments on EVELIXIA’s middleware layer brokerage, orchestration, workflow management and components functional integration. This report is considered as the first version of D3.8.

result.title: Stakeholders Interaction Platform
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 4.5, consolidating all foreseen technical developments on mechanisms improving EVELIXIA’s end-users’ and stakeholders’ interaction experience. This report is considered as the first version of D4.6.

result.title: BLOCKCHAIN Smart Flexibility Contracting
result.description: This deliverable is directly linked to the activities foreseen in Task 3.4 and Task 3.5, consolidating all foreseen technical developments on EVELIXIA’s smart-marketplace-contracting mechanisms and blockchain security mechanisms. This report is considered as the first version of D3.6.

category.title: sensors
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/electronic engineering/sensors

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
